## SingleSelectQuestion interface

Definition of single selection question

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface SingleSelectQuestion extends UserInputQuestion 
```
<b>Extends:</b> [UserInputQuestion](./teamsfx-api.userinputquestion.md)

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [default?](./teamsfx-api.singleselectquestion.default.md) | string \| [LocalFunc](./teamsfx-api.localfunc.md)<!-- -->&lt;string \| undefined&gt; | <i>(Optional)</i> The default selected <code>id</code> value of the option item |
|  [dynamicOptions?](./teamsfx-api.singleselectquestion.dynamicoptions.md) | [DynamicOptions](./teamsfx-api.dynamicoptions.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> dynamic option, which has higher priority than static options |
|  [returnObject?](./teamsfx-api.singleselectquestion.returnobject.md) | boolean | <i>(Optional)</i> This config only works for option items with <code>OptionItem[]</code> type. If <code>returnObject</code> is true, the answer value is an <code>OptionItem</code> object; otherwise, the answer value is the <code>id</code> string of the <code>OptionItem</code>. In case of option items with <code>string[]</code> type, whether <code>returnObject</code> is true or false, the returned answer value is always a string. |
|  [skipSingleOption?](./teamsfx-api.singleselectquestion.skipsingleoption.md) | boolean | <i>(Optional)</i> whether to skip the single option select question if true: single select question will be automatically answered with the single option; if false: use still need to do the selection manually even there is no other choice. |
|  [staticOptions](./teamsfx-api.singleselectquestion.staticoptions.md) | [StaticOptions](./teamsfx-api.staticoptions.md) | static options array CLI's help command focus only on this static option |
|  [type](./teamsfx-api.singleselectquestion.type.md) | "singleSelect" |  |
|  [value?](./teamsfx-api.singleselectquestion.value.md) | string \| [OptionItem](./teamsfx-api.optionitem.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> answer value, which is the <code>id</code> string or <code>OptionItem</code> object |
